alert.note: Alert for Saratoga (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 08 at 4:12PM EDT until September 08 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following counties, Albany, Saratoga and Schenectady. * WHEN...Until 715 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 410 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. The public reported minor flooding is ongoing in the City of Schenectady. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Schenectady, Clifton Park, Rotterdam, Colonie, Scotia, Niskayuna, Duanesburg, Berne, Altamont, East Glenville, Alplaus, Burnt Hills, Knox, Princetown, Duane, South Schenectady, Bellevue, Pine Grove, Hungry Hill and Coldbrook. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
